actions.committee: House Committee on Education and Labor
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and Labor.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Education and Labor
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Employment Opportunities.

official_title: To provide grants for State pilot programs to retrain individuals in low paying and low skill jobs in order to reduce unemployment and increase the pool of skilled workers in the United States.

summary.text: Worker Retraining Act of 1991 - Directs the Secretary of Labor to provide pilot program grants to assist not more than ten selected States to plan, establish, and operate worker retraining initiatives to allow employed low-income individuals to advance from low skill to higher skill positions in the industry in which they are employed. Sets forth requirements for: (1) selection of States; (2) regional distribution of such grants; (3) applications; and (4) reports. Authorizes appropriations.

titles.title: To provide grants for State pilot programs to retrain individuals in low paying and low skill jobs in order to reduce unemployment and increase the pool of skilled workers in the United States.
